results.title: The Laser beam
results.creator_credit: Leo A. Handel and Handel Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Uses animation to explain the principle of the laser. Shows some of the applications of lasers in medicine, industry, communications, space exploration and the holograms that may lead to three-dimensional television. Traces the history of lasers and shows how emission spectra and lasers are related. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Great Cognito
results.creator_credit: Will Vinton and Will Vinton Productions
results.brief_description: The most recent Will Vinton clay animated production introduces the Great Cognito a talented impersonator who really throws himself into his work. Accompanying his visual metamorphoses with a rapid-fire commentary, he entertains his audience with hilarious impersonations of public figures.

results.title: Short story
results.brief_description: Encourages discussion about how writers choose and select material and use language, using Irish writer Frank O’Connor’s short story “Masculine protest”, about a twelve-year-old runaway, as a basis for discussion.

results.title: Duane Hanson
results.brief_description: American sculptor Duane Hanson is a major figure in the neo-realist movement. He casts real people in plastic moulds and uses the painted cast, dressed and lifelike figures to make social and political comments which can be disturbing.

results.title: Communication games in a language programme
results.brief_description: Shows a London intensive English language course with tertiary foreign students , based on games involving information gaps or opinion gaps which force students to communicate, seek information, argue and disagree.

results.title: Building of the earth
results.brief_description: Examines volcanic action and plate tectonics, the extreme cold of polar and high altitude regions, and how living organisms have adapted those environments. Teachers advised to view in advance so that segments may be identified as appropriate to concentration spans.

results.title: Talkback radio with John Pearce
results.brief_description: Former Sydney Broadcaster John Pearce discusses his views on the relationship between talk-back radio and radio programming. Within his role as a talk-back radio host, he says he needed to remain in control of the calls and scored points off the callers as necessary in the interests of a high rating show. Interviewed by Bryon Quigley. No other credits available.

results.title: Up against it
results.creator_credit: Cath Cantlon and Henley Beach Mural Collective
results.brief_description: A documentary on the painting of a large mural on a sea wall at Adelaide’s Henley Beach. Shows the design considerations, research, the process of involving the local council and school students, and the preparation and painting of the wall.
